burlap.behavior.singleagent.learning.actorcritic

Interface Critic

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    TDLambda, TimeIndexedTDLambda

    public interface Critic
    This interface provides the methods necessary for implementing the critic part of an actor-critic learning algorithm. The critic is responsible for observing behavior (state, action, state tuples) and returning a critique of that behavior. Typically, Critic objects will need to take as input a reward function to judge this behavior.
    Author:
    James MacGlashan

      void endEpisode()
      This method is called whenever a learning episode terminates
      void initializeEpisode(State s)
      This method is called whenever a new learning episode begins
      void resetData()
      Used to reset any data that was created/modified during learning so that learning can be begin anew.

    • Method Detail

      • addNonDomainReferencedAction

        void addNonDomainReferencedAction(Action a)
        This method allows the critic to critique actions that are not apart of the domain definition.
        Parameters:
        a - a an action not apart of the of the domain definition that this critic should be able to crique.

      • initializeEpisode

        void initializeEpisode(State s)
        This method is called whenever a new learning episode begins
        Parameters:
        s - the initial state of the new learning episode

      • endEpisode

        void endEpisode()
        This method is called whenever a learning episode terminates

      • critiqueAndUpdate

        CritiqueResult critiqueAndUpdate(State s,
                               GroundedAction ga,
                               State sprime)
        This method's implementation provides the critique for some specific instance of the behavior.
        Parameters:
        s - an input state
        ga - an action taken in s
        sprime - the state the agent transitioned to for taking action ga in state s
        Returns:
        the critique of this behavior.

      • resetData

        void resetData()
        Used to reset any data that was created/modified during learning so that learning can be begin anew.
